title: Newfoundland and Labrador Route 450
text:
Route 450 (also known as <a href="James%20Cook">Captain Cook</a>'s Trail) is a highway in the <a href="Canada">Canadian</a> province of <a href="Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador">Newfoundland and Labrador</a>. The highway starts at an interchange at <a href="Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador%20Route%201">Route 1</a> (<a href="Trans-Canada%20Highway">Trans-Canada Highway</a>) in <a href="Corner%20Brook">Corner Brook</a>. When approaching O'Connell Drive, motorists can turn left to continue their journey along the route. The route terminates at a <a href="cul-de-sac">cul-de-sac</a> in <a href="Lark%20Harbour">Lark Harbour</a>.
Route 450 made headlines in Newfoundland in January 2018 when massive rainfall caused flooding on January 13 and created a huge crater causing a large portion in the highway to collapse, thus separating residents in Lark Harbour and <a href="York%20Harbour">York Harbour</a> from the remainder of the island. The impacted portion of the road was reopened to traffic on January 17, 2018.
Route description.
Route 450 begins in <a href="Corner%20Brook%2C%20Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador">Corner Brook</a> at an interchange with <a href="Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador%20Route%201">Route 1</a> (<a href="Trans-Canada%20Highway">Trans-Canada Highway</a>, Exit 4), with the road continuing northeast as Massey Drive to the town of the same <a href="Massey%20Drive%2C%20Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador">name</a>. It heads west along the southern edge of the city to have an intersection with Wheelers Road, which provides access to the <a href="Grenfell%20Campus">Grenfell Campus</a>. The highway now heads northwest through neighbourhood/industrial area to have intersections with Mac Donald Brown Drive, Lundrigan Drive, Sunnyslope Drive, O'Connell Drive, before making a sharp left turn at an intersection with <a href="Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador%20Route%20450A">Route 450A</a> (Lewin Parkway). Route 450 now passes through the <a href="Curling%2C%20Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador">Curling</a> section of town before leaving Corner Brook before winding its along the southern shore of <a href="Humber%20Arm">Humber Arm</a> to pass through <a href="Mount%20Moriah%2C%20Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador">Mount Moriah</a> (where it crosses <a href="Cooks%20Brook%20%28Newfoundland%29">Cooks Brook</a>), <a href="Humber%20Arm%20South%2C%20Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador">Humber Arm South</a> (where a couple of turns are needed to stay on the highway, one to the right, and the other to the left), and <a href="York%20Harbour%2C%20Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador">York Harbour</a>, all within the rugged terrain of the <a href="Lewis%20Hills">Lewis Hills</a> portion of the <a href="Long%20Range%20Mountains">Long Range Mountains</a>. The highway now enters <a href="Lark%20Harbour%2C%20Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador">Lark Harbour</a> and passes by <a href="Blow%20Me%20Down%20Provincial%20Park">Blow Me Down Provincial Park</a> before passing through town, where it has an intersection with a local road leading to <a href="Bottle%20Cove%2C%20Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador">Bottle Cove</a> and <a href="Little%20Port%2C%20Newfoundland%20and%20Labrador">Little Port</a>, before the pavement (and Route 450) comes to an end at the eastern edge of town.
